main_definition: A mortgage is a legal agreement in which a bank or other financial institution lends money to an individual, who uses their property as collateral until the loan is paid off.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A long-term loan used for purchasing real estate
meanings_and_examples.example: John took out a 30-year mortgage to buy his first home.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The money that is borrowed to finance the purchase of property
meanings_and_examples.example: The total amount of her mortgage was $250,000 for a new house.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A legal document outlining the terms and conditions of the loan
meanings_and_examples.example: She carefully reviewed all the details in her mortgage agreement before signing it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The interest rate charged on a mortgage loan
meanings_and_examples.example: His fixed-rate mortgage has an annual interest rate of 3.5%.
